head.supplied: April 4 [18]9[0] ¶ Baron F. Von Mueller K.C.M.G. FRS &c ¶ Melbourne ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ Mr J. H. Maiden has today shown me a letter, in which you request him to ask me to obtain botanical specimens for you wh...

div.p: ML MSS.853/1, item 2, letter press copy book, p. 50, Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (NSW Branch) records, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.
Baron F. Von Mueller K.C.M.G. FRS &c

Mr J. H. Maiden has today shown me a letter, in which you request him to ask me to obtain botanical specimens for you whilst travelling through central Australia for the N. S. Wales branch of the R. G. Society of Australasia.
On the impulse of the moment I promised Mr Maiden I would do as you requested.
You will allow me to remind you, sir, that I have often sent you botanical specimens when passing through little known parts of Australia.
On [more] [...], I find myself [...] regret that I cannot do as you wish.

All the funds for my expedition are supplied by members of this Society[.] And moreover this Society alone has ever assisted me in exploratory work. I will collect specimens as you desire, but the same will be forwarded to the Executive of this branch of the Society, who doubtless will make satisfactory arrangements as regards their disposal.
Were I travelling on my own account of course I would be only too happy to place my humble labours at your disposal.
